string.text: Transport
Niva 2121
Passenger car with increased off-road performance.\n Trunk load: 60 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
BTR-70(z)

An armored personnel carrier, used by army detachments in the Zone for patrolling. Has almost nothing common with the primary prototype. Has strengthened armour, thermal aiming and image identification module, electronic aiming and barrel stabilization systems. The hull has been made airtight, all analogue controls have been replaced with actuator systems. The APC is fully operable by a single person and allows aimed fire to be carried on by means of an integrated gun. There's still room for a landing party. \n Trunk load: 100 kg.\n Items required for use: very heavy accumulator battery, plenty of fuel.
Mi-24 helicopter
An army assault helicopter.\n Capacity: eight paratroopers with weapons, ammunition and equipment.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
KAMAZ truck
A commonly used Soviet truck. Big and reliable.\n Capacity: the driver, his friends and damn plenty of stuff.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
Traktor
Abandoned machinery found its use in the Zone. Has great rough-terrain performance, but grouses a lot.\n Trunk load: 40 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
Moskvich 2141

A passenger vehicle. In spite of its disadvantages was quite popular with the summer residents. Was also frequently used by the police.\n Trunk load: 60 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
Moskvich 412
ZAZ 965 ("humpback")

Aka "zaporozhets" - a transport loved by everybody and glorified in an enormous amount of jokes. Has adequate rough-terrain performance and a wonderful antitheft protection: "Hell no, man, I ain't gonna steal this piece 'a shit!"\n Trunk load: 40 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel, strong hands to push this rust forward.
ZAZ 968 ("lop-eared")

By no means less popular in the jokes descendant of the "humpbacked", produced by the Zaporozhsky Car Factory.\n Trunk load: 40 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel, something to push this rust forward (hands or legs, depending on the degree of disability of the owner).
UAZ 469 ("goatling")
Product of the Uralsky Car Factory. A reliable "goatling". Proved itself good in the army use.\n Trunk load: 80 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
UAZ 3962 ("brick")
A reliable minivan with remarkable flotation.\n Trunk load: 100 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
Buggy

Handmade of metal scrap. It's fast, cheap and allows all-round fire. Has got no armour.\n Trunk load: 40 kg.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel and nitrous oxide if you happen to find it.
ZIL MMZ truck

These trucks have gained themselves an ill fame in the Zone - they are mostly known as "Death trucks".\n Capacity: it's very doubtful that anybody ever counted the dead bodies in the trunk.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
GAZ 66 truck ("shishiga")

Russian pronunciation of the number of the hull (66) gave this truck its nickname - "shishiga", which means an evil wood goblin female. A reliable truck with nice off-road performance. It's almost a house with wheels.\n Capacity: great.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
GAZ 53 bus
A bus based on the GAZ-53 truck.\n Capacity: great.\n Items required for use: heavy accumulator battery, fuel.
